smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain elements and are not empty.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are connected to at least one actor.
No distinct use cases with synonymous names describing the same activity were found associated with the same actor.
No package contains multiple model elements with the same name.
While some tables share column names (e.g., 'nimetus'), these represent different attributes (e.g., Car Name vs. Brand Name) rather than redundant data copies.

Inconsistent naming forms are used for use cases. On the 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)' diagram (Page 2), use cases like 'Aktiivsed autod' and 'Kõik autod' use Noun phrases, while 'Tuvasta kasutaja' uses a Verb phrase. The 'Muuda' diagram (Page 3) uses Verb phrases ('Registreeri auto').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9) appear reachable via transitions from the Start node.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4) are reachable through the decision paths defined.
Relationships on class and database diagrams generally have multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*') visible on at least one end, or explicitly defined on both ends.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements (classes, tables, use cases, or states). The most populated diagrams have fewer than 10 central nodes.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The 'Isik' class (Page 6) has 5 connections, which is below the threshold.
The layout of elements on all diagrams is reasonably compact with no outliers exceeding the distance threshold.
On the 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)' diagram (Page 2), several use cases do not start with an active verb: 'Aktiivsed autod', 'Kõik autod', and 'Autode koondaruanne'.
All class, table, and attribute names found are longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto' are 4 characters).
Class names obey the convention (Singular and Capitalized, e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
Attribute names obey the convention (lowercase start, e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus').

On the 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)' database diagram (Page 17) and 'Autode register (Töötaja)' (Page 18), the table name 'Autod' is plural, whereas other tables are singular (e.g., 'Tootaja', 'Klient').
No inappropriate type prefixes (e.g., tbl_, str) were found on element names. Allowed prefixes like PK_ and FK_ are used in database diagrams.
